text: Ingalls is a city in Gray County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 252 people lived there. ==History== The first post office in Ingalls was created in May 1887 with the name Soule. It kept that name until May 1888. The city was renamed for Kansas senator John James Ingalls. Ingalls could have been the county seat in the late 1880s. It once had the county offices. ==Geography== Ingalls is at (37.829932, -100.453844). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 252 people, 97 households, and 71 families living in Ingalls. Of the households, 71.1% owned their home and 28.9% rented their home. The median age was 32.6 years. Of the people, 78.2% were White, 1.6% were Black, 0.8% were Asian, 0.4% were Native American, 10.7% were from some other race, and 8.3% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 30.2% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 306 people, 113 households, and 87 families living in Ingalls. ==Education== Ingalls is served by USD 477 Ingalls. The Ingalls High School mascot is the Bulldogs. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Ingalls - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 477, local school district ;Maps * Ingalls City Map, KDOT Category:Cities in Gray County, Kansas
title: Ingalls, Kansas
